Cyprus: Salamis was rebuilt by Constantius II, the son of Constantine, after being destroyed by earthquakes and was renamed Constantia.
Indinesia: The Kutai Martadipura phase in East Kalimantan produced the earliest known stone inscriptions in Indonesia. (to 400)
Japan: Unification of Yamato Province, possibly when under the foreign rule of Baekje and/or Gaya confederacy derived king
